This is the complete ridiculous successful multiplay game. and hat fortress 2
Amazing game that is still relevant after a lot of years.

In short, its a fantastic game. The gameplay, the cartoony graphics, weapon mechanics, the 10 year olds asking for unusuals, especially those, all gucci. It's insanely fun to play with friends, and the post death ragdolls are what makes this game a smash your mother on the couch out of 10. You will occasionally find some twat hacking, but it's happened very rarely based on the games I have been in. 
Remember to play Never gonna give you up through voice chat fellas.

10/10 - IGN

A masterpiece.


Everything about this game is wondrous. The movement, the mercenaries, the guns, everything!
It has unique characters who aren't just there to shoot and have actual personalities shown in the comics, voice lines and the incredible "meet the" videos. It has its own fashion, taunts and a reasonably priced economy (looking at you, CS:GO). And the best part about it is the community. Even after 13 whole years, they are still making maps, creating new weapons, new cosmetics and most importantly, still playing. I love this game with every aspect of it. Nine years of development was absolutely worth it. And I hope to see this game becoming more popular.
El mejor juego free 2 play en steam.

When I look at this game in my steam library, I get a small but powerful wave of nostalgia. All of the people I've met and made friends here on Steam, was right in this game. I left a whole generation behind. But now, I heard that this game is getting infected with bots. I felt like that this game is like a zombie. Dead, but still moving. But ever since that one tweet, I think it came back as a human being. Some characters had left me an impact on my life, and some servers too. I actually got steam to play this game on my crappy laptop because I saw that one "meet the" video, and it was my type of game too. I got killed left and right but I still had fun, mostly because of my person flying around. I remember a review on this game saying something of the lines of "you don't quit the game, you just take really long breaks." Sometimes i even wonder if I even played this game. I remember playing this game like its yesterday. This game will probably be left in my memory for the rest of my life, and so will many others. Some might be small, but others may leave an impact, which includes this one. Maybe I should give this game another shot sometime later when I feel like it, who knows, but it will never be never. Every single laugh I had in this game was memorable. I had every single bit of fun on this game, and I believe that I have peaked in terms of skill. I will probably will have a lot more fun once I come back. But right now this game isn't my type of game, maybe later. I know that 1665.4 hours isn't much to all of you, but it impresses me how much I spent on this game. Team Fortress 2 is a name I will never forget, and along with many others. Thank you for all of the good times... and letting me grow.
